channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Hong Kong man jailed for T-shirt protest slogan
item.description: A Hong Kong man has been sentenced to 14 months in prison for sedition under the city's new national security law after wearing a T-shirt with a protest slogan. The court ruled that the slogan could incite secession, making this the first sedition conviction under the new legislation.

item.title: Israeli citizen arrested for alleged Iranian-assisted plot to assassinate Netanyahu
item.description: Israeli police and Shin Bet have apprehended an Israeli citizen accused of being recruited by Iranian intelligence to orchestrate the assassinations of key officials, including Prime Minister Netanyahu. The suspect, a businessman with ties to Turkey and Iran, was reportedly involved in several security missions within Israel and received payment for his actions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Walkie-talkies in Lebanon blasts were made at least a decade ago
item.description: Among the many outstanding questions is how explosive materials were planted in the devices. If the Icom walkie-talkies were first manufactured a decade ago, it’s possible they were modified well after sale to their original customers.

item.title: Inside the Brooklyn federal jail where Sean 'Diddy' Combs is locked up: violence, squalor and death
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs has been incarcerated at Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center following his arrest on sex trafficking charges. The facility, notorious for its poor conditions and safety concerns, houses approximately 1,200 detainees. Combs' legal team contends that the jail is inappropriate for pretrial detention given its history of violence and recent fatalities.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump buys fans burgers and pays with Bitcoin at New York bar
item.description: Donald Trump visited a Bitcoin-themed bar in New York, purchasing burgers with Bitcoin to garner support from cryptocurrency enthusiasts. He is promoting a new project called World Liberty Financial. Despite facing protests outside, Trump's appearance received applause from both Bitcoin supporters and his loyalists inside the bar.

item.title: North Korea tests ballistic missile capable of carrying 'super-large' warhead
item.description: North Korea reported testing a tactical ballistic missile carrying a super-large warhead and an upgraded strategic cruise missile, overseen by Kim Jong Un. He emphasized enhancing military capabilities for self-defense. This development aligns with strengthened ties between North Korea and Russia, and precedes parliamentary measures expected to escalate tensions with South Korea.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Had to sign or face consequences': Venezuela’s opposition leader claims he was forced to admit defeat
item.description: Venezuelan opposition candidate Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia disclosed he was coerced into signing a letter conceding defeat to Nicolas Maduro. Now granted asylum in Madrid, Urrutia insists the letter is invalid and maintains his electoral victory. Numerous countries refuse to acknowledge Maduro's win without a full vote breakdown from the CNE.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Yale, Princeton and Duke are questioned over decline in Asian students
'Turn off your phone!' Blast causes panic at funeral for pager attack victims
Pannun files civil lawsuit in US against GOI, Doval and others, seeks damages
item.description: Gurpatwant Singh Pannun of Sikhs for Justice has filed a civil lawsuit against the Indian government and key officials in a US court. He seeks compensation for an alleged assassination attempt on him last year. The plot, involving high-ranking Indian officials, was foiled by undercover US agents. Pannun claims ongoing threats to his life.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Sean Diddy says he won't bring women home in his fresh bail plea
item.description: Sean Diddy has submitted a fresh bail plea after his initial request was denied. Facing charges of racketeering, sex trafficking, and transportation for prostitution, he promises not to allow women into his Florida mansion. Arrested after multiple allegations of sexual abuse during 'freak off' sessions, Diddy has not pleaded guilty and claims innocence.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US intensifies criticism of Pak ballistic missile programme
item.description: The United States reaffirms its long-standing opposition to supporting Pakistan's ballistic missile program, emphasizing continued enforcement of sanctions for national security. Recent US sanctions targeted a Chinese research institute and companies for allegedly supplying missile-related items to Pakistan. In response, Pakistan criticized the actions as biased and politically motivated.
item.dc:creator: Omer Farooq Khan

item.title: Kimberly Guilfoyle now shares a kissing photo with Donald Trump Jr amid Bettina Anderson row
item.description: ​"I would love to see you in the White House Kimberly. The Trump family will never find another loyal and dedicated individual as yourself...." a follower wrote to Kimberly's Instagram post in which she was seen with Donald Trump Jr at an event during the weekends. The photos come amid speculations of tension in their relationship because pf Don Jr's apparent proximity with Bettina Anderson.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tesla, SpaceX, X employees donate more to Kamala Harris, despite Musk's support for Trump
item.description: Elon Musk endorses Donald Trump for the upcoming US presidential election, contrasting with his employees at Tesla, SpaceX, and X who support Kamala Harris. OpenSecrets data reveals significant donations from employees to Harris's campaign. Previously a supporter of Joe Biden in 2020, Musk has now shifted his political stance to the right.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After pagers, walkie-talkies blasts, Israel says 'many capabilities yet to be activated'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: At least two killed in gas field explosion in Uzbekistan
item.description: An explosion at an under-construction gas field in Uzbekistan killed at least two people and injured others. Occurring near Baysun, this follows a previous incident releasing hydrogen sulphide gas. Authorities closed schools and evacuated workers. Discovered during the Soviet era, the gas field is now being developed with foreign investment.

item.title: Does Barron Trump really have 4 crypto wallets? Why it matters
item.description: ​“Barron knows so much about this, Barron’s a young guy, but he knows. He talks about his wallet, he’s got four wallets or something, and I’ll say ‘what is a wallet?’” Donald Trump said at the launch of the World Liberty Financial -- the crypto project of the Trumps. 18-year-old Barron is the DeFi visionary of this project and as claimed by his father, Barron has exceptional understanding about crypto.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: MAGA mom mocks Kamala for not having biological children
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Explosives found near Donald Trump's rally site at Long Island? Cops say 'no threat'
item.description: After two assassination attempts on former president Donald Trump, explosives were reportedly found in a car near the site where Donald Trump is scheduled to address a rally at Long Island. Nassau County Police department confirmed that there was a suspicious occurrence on Wednesday ahead of Trump's address but there was no threat to the Republican presidential candidate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump says she's proud of her nude modeling work: 'Are we no longer...?'
item.description: Melania Trump said more that her nude modeling works the media scrutiny on her past profession is a graver concern. In a teaser video of her upcoming memoir, she addressed the concern that became a bothering question during the 2016 election campaign -- to-be first lady's nude shoots. As Trump runs for reelection and his fashion model wife emerges as a writer, Melania answers the question.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
